definition[0]: to deliberately try to influence or change a situation that does not concern you, or that you do not understand
example[0]: He accused the US of meddling in China’s internal affairs.
example[1]: I don’t like other people meddling in the way I run this prison.
example[2]: I’m not the sort of newspaper owner who meddles with editorial policy.
definition[1]: to touch something which you should not touch, especially in a careless way that might break it
example[3]: You have no right to come in here meddling with my things.
